decks.notes: The deck focuses on using artifact creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. It utilizes disruptive artifacts to slow down the opponent's game plan while deploying threats such as Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista to deal damage efficiently. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early in the game and maintain pressure to close out the game quickly. By combining powerful artifact creatures with mana acceleration and disruptive elements, the deck aims to overpower the opponent in a fast-paced manner.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Doomsday combo and win the game on the spot by casting Thassa's Oracle with an empty library. The deck includes various cantrips and tutors to manipulate the top of the library and find the necessary combo pieces. It also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's strategy. The deck is designed to be fast and efficient, prioritizing the combo over traditional control elements.

The focus of this deck is to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Monastery Mentor, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast. Cards like Dack Fayden and Hullbreacher provide card advantage and disrupt opponent's strategies, while Teferi, Time Raveler can protect your own spells from counterspells. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by efficiently drawing cards and countering key spells, eventually overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive spells.

The main strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient combination of artifact creatures and disruptive artifacts. By using cards like Arcbound Ravager, Phyrexian Revoker, and Walking Ballista, the player can quickly build a board presence while controlling their opponent's resources with cards like Chalice of the Void, Sphere of Resistance, and Trinisphere. The mana acceleration provided by Mishra's Workshop and the artifact mana sources allows the player to deploy threats quickly and efficiently, putting pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the game while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By combining powerful cards like Dreadhorde Arcanist, Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, and Monastery Mentor with a suite of efficient cantrips and counterspells, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and quickly close out the game. By leveraging the card advantage from cards like Dack Fayden and Narset, Parter of Veils, as well as strong tempo plays like Time Walk, this Jeskai Xerox build aims to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory through superior card quality and board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful disruptive spells like Force of Will, Pyroblast, and Oko, Thief of Crowns. The key strategy revolves around the Oath of Druids card, which allows the player to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Niv-Mizzet, Parun into play. The deck also utilizes various card draw and selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find key pieces quickly. Additionally, it includes disruptive spells like Flusterstorm and Veil of Summer to protect its game plan and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. To support this strategy, the deck includes cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to search for key pieces, Lodestone Golem to slow down opponents, and Sphere of Resistance to disrupt their game plan. The deck also includes cards like Leyline of the Void to deal with graveyard strategies and Mishra's Workshop to generate additional mana for casting spells. By efficiently assembling the combo, this deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of powerful planeswalkers, counterspells, and disruptive creatures. It aims to generate card advantage, manipulate resources, and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a variety of versatile and efficient spells to control the board, such as counterspells, removal, and card draw. Additionally, it utilizes the graveyard as a resource with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Eternal Witness. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and includes powerful lands like fetch lands and dual lands.

The main idea behind this deck is to utilize artifact creatures and powerful artifacts to create a proactive aggressive strategy, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with various stax pieces like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst. The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through lands like Mishra's Workshop and Moxen, while also having access to powerful cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Crucible of Worlds to create a strong board presence and lock the opponent out of the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while quickly deploying threats of its own. It utilizes a combination of powerful cards like Narset, Parter of Veils, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure, while also having disruptive elements such as Collector Ouphe, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to control the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish a dominant board presence to secure victory in the early stages of the game.

The deck focuses on using fast and disruptive spells like Force of Will, Mindbreak Trap, and Mental Misstep to protect its aggressive creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Hollow One. The deck also utilizes the Bazaar of Baghdad to dig for cards and fill the graveyard with creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, enabling powerful graveyard recursion with cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the powerful Doomsday combo to set up a winning sequence of cards that can either win the game outright or put the player in a very favorable position. The deck includes a variety of card draw and manipulation spells to help assemble the necessary cards for the combo, as well as a suite of counterspells and disruption to protect the combo from being disrupted by the opponent. The deck also includes efficient mana acceleration and tutors to help find key combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly mill through the deck and put creatures into the graveyard, triggering powerful effects like Prized Amalgam and Bridge from Below. The deck aims to create a strong board presence early on by recurring creatures and using cards like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes control elements like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. Overall, the deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of graveyard recursion and disruptive plays.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the 5-card combo of Doomsday along with Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck is packed with cantrips and tutors to find the combo pieces efficiently, along with disruption in the form of counterspells and hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck can also use Necropotence and other card draw spells to draw through the library quickly and set up the Doomsday win condition. The key strategy is to protect the combo while assembling it as fast as possible.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the game using powerful planeswalker cards like Dack Fayden, Oko, and Wrenn and Six, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Pyroblast. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through the use of cards like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm. The deck also includes mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and powerful lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to help maintain control of the game and dictate the pace of play.

The deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome in combination with fast mana artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards while bouncing artifacts back to hand for extra value. It aims to quickly assemble a lethal combo or lock opponents out of the game using cards like Tinker, Yawgmoth's Will, and Bolas's Citadel. Additionally, disruptive cards like Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and Mental Misstep help protect the combo and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck thrives on synergy between artifact-based acceleration and powerful draw spells.
